name: Standard Arabic

dialects.name: Classical Arabic
dialects.notes: Language of the Quran and classical literature

dialects.name: Modern Standard Arabic
dialects.notes: Contemporary formal register used in media, education, and official communication

description: Standard Arabic is the literary and formal register of Arabic, used in writing, formal speech, news broadcasts, and religious contexts across the Arab world. It serves as the liturgical language of Islam and is the basis for Modern Standard Arabic used in contemporary media and education. While regional spoken dialects vary significantly, Standard Arabic provides a unified written form understood across Arabic-speaking regions.
